text: Tap, Bills Beer garden, Ann Arbor, MI. Banana bubblegum aroma. Mild flavour. Sweet with ginger and yeast. Long warm finish.

On draft at the brewery. The pour is a foggy orangey gold with a white ring of head and no lace. The aroma is a good cross of bubblegum, Belgian yeast, and a stranger banana influence. The flavor is very similar. The yeast is first, then the bubblegum, and it finishes like a banana cream pie. Really different than I was expecting. The mouth feel is decent with a soft carbonation and a lighter finish. The aftertaste is strong banana and Belgian yeast. Not awful at all

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the brewery. Aroma is banana creme, light bubble gum, and lemon pez. Tastes awesome. Sweet creamy banana cream pie and just a touch of bubblegum. Medium to full body. So smooth. Awesome tripel.
Growler pour from the brewery. Pours a slightly hazy deep golden with a white head. Yeasty clove and bubble gum aroma, green grape. Flavor is similar, but kind of on the light side for a tripel.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate citrus, light banana, and a touch of Belgian yeast. Its a a hazy dull golden-orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a slightly thicker ring. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy citrus, light Belgian yeast, and a touch of candi sugar. The finish has light-moderate orange peel, light banana, and grapefruit. Its medium bodied with light-moderate carbonation. Overall, its hoppier than most Tripels.

Aroma is of bitter hay up front with hidden sourness and caramel in the background. Appears a clear golden copper with a thin ring of white foam. Tastes bitter upfront of hay, there is a slight sourness, followed by a caramel and bubblegum sweetness. Palate is a little syrupy, and a little fizzy. Overall, good.

Tap at brewery. Exceptionally well done tripel. Sour nose. Bubbly deep amber honey. Lingering foam. Tastes perfectly balanced between banana, clove, bubblegum, candi sugar and the ABV. Just a slight burn to balance the sweetness.

I absolutely love this place! The environment is so friendly and you feel very welcomed! Now onto the beer this beer has been one of the best beer I have ever had in my life! The smoothest the flavors all hit youre pallet at once and makes one beautiful crafted beer if you are ever in the area come stop by!

First impression is Im immediately reminded of final absolution from dragon meade. This is like an amber version of that. Slight banana taste, sweet and nutty. Strong after taste. Not a session beer, the taste becomes too much after awhile. Really worth it for any fan of belgium triples.
Draft at the brewery.  Golden/copper pour with dense white head.  Smooth banana and light clove.  Great stuff.
